oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Catless Cat Carriers and the AABP
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Gardner, Charlie
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: surgical procedures
equipment
drugs
cases
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: In dairy practice it is quite common to do surgical procedures in barns. One minor but definite problem we deal with is getting all the needed drugs and equipment into the barn where the surgery is to be performed. We now find that doctors prefer the cat carriers over the wooden cases, even though they don't hold quite as much. I have also used cardboard "banker's boxes" to carry the same equipment. These take up even less room in the truck, and carry everything I need as long as -I lay the bottles of scrub and alcohol down.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 1989; 192
